meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of a neophyte.
meanings.sent1: The neophytic student was eager to learn and improve.
meanings.sent2: She felt neophytic when she started her first day at the new job.
meanings.sent3: The neophytic chef accidentally mistook salt for sugar in the recipe.
meanings.sent4: His neophytic approach to painting brought a fresh perspective to the art world.
meanings.sent5: The neophytic gardener carefully tended to each plant, hoping they would thrive.

meanings.definition: Inexperienced or new to a particular activity or field.
meanings.sent1: The neophytic team struggled to keep up with the seasoned players.
meanings.sent2: As a neophytic traveler, she was excited to explore new cultures.
meanings.sent3: The neophytic driver accidentally turned on the windshield wipers instead of the signal.
meanings.sent4: Her neophytic attempts at knitting resulted in a tangled mess of yarn.
meanings.sent5: The neophytic actor nervously awaited their first performance on stage.
